public class zeta.util.Annotation

(source file: Annotation.pizza)
java.lang.Object
   |
   +----zeta.util.Annotation
The pure class interface. 
public class Annotation
  implements Serializable, Formattable
An annotation is a mutable collection of attributes which may be attached to terms. For each attribute kind, a so-called annotation slot is allocated. The class which defines an annotation slot provides customized interfaces to retrieve and update the attribute in the slot of an annotation. The user of annotations usually only needs to know these interfaces.

A user can define arbitrarily new annotation slots; see class Slot.

Author:
wg@cs.tu-berlin.de
Version: $Id: Annotation.pizza,v 1.1.1.1 1998/09/01 10:51:12 wg Exp $
See also:

Annotation
public Annotation();

dontFormat
public static boolean dontFormat;
A boolean flag which indicates to suppress formats for annotations.

get
public Object get(int index);
Get value associated with given slot index.

Parameters:
index - the slot index
Returns:
the value associated with slot, or null if no one is provided.

isProvided

public boolean isProvided(int index);
Test whether value is provided for slot index.

Parameters:
index - the slot index
Returns:
true if a value is provided

put

public void put(int index,
                Object val);
Put value associated with given slot index.

Parameters:
index - the slot index
obj - the value to store. May be null in order to clear the slot

copy

public Annotation copy();
Make a shallow copy of the given annotation. The stored values themself will not be copied.

copyInto

public void copyInto(Annotation other);
Copy the values of this annotation into other annotation, completely replacing the others content.

putInto

public void putInto(Annotation other);
Add the values of this annotation to other annotation, overwriting possible older definitions.

getProvidedSlots

public Slot[] getProvidedSlots();
Return array of slots which are provided .

public Format toFormat(FormatInfo info);
Format annotation.
